intro: Dianthera bicalyculata, commonly known as the two-lobed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. Dianthera bicalyculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking appearance.
